intro: Pandaca cuneata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf pandaca, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants such as coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
